thread.title: Guy gives homeless cats hilarious 'likes and dislikes' to help them get adopted | Metro News
thread.title_full: Guy gives homeless cats hilarious 'likes and dislikes' to help them get adopted | Metro News

author: Hattie Gladwell For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Guy gives homeless cats hilarious 'likes and dislikes' to help them get adopted | Metro News
text:
Hattie Gladwell for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 1:14 pm (Picture: Obvious Plant) 
It’s a sad truth that so many cats go un-adopted because of the way they look. 
Perhaps they’re not small enough, chubby enough, or fluffy enough. Maybe their fur isn’t the right colour or their tail’s too stumpy. 
Whatever the ridiculous reason, more often than not people are missing out on homing a great cat. 
One guy who realises this is Jeff Wysaski, AKA Obvious Plant, an animal-loving comedian who has created description tags for the cats in his local animal shelter in order to help re-home them. 
Imagining a personality for each cat, Jeff listed their likes and dislikes, and left the listings outside the entrance to Sante D’Or Animal Rescue in Los Angeles. 
Posting his work to his Facebook page , Jeff wrote: ‘I gave these adoptable cats some interesting likes and dislikes. 
‘All these cats are real and need a home!’ 
Check out Jeff’s work below. Meet Lola, a grey cat who loves to sunbathe (Picture: Obvious Plant) Guinevere hates when someone steals her Mario game (Picture: Obvious Plant) ‘That’s our word’– Sylvia (Picture: Obvious Plant) Never treat Dinky like a baby. He’s an adult, people (Picture: Obvious Plant) As you can tell by her photo, Honey likes Catnip (a lot) (Picture: Obvious Plant) Sabrina’s very specific in what she does and doesn’t like (Picture: Obvious Plant) Camille hates fart jokes. Fair. (Picture: Obvious Plant) Zeta is gorgeous, and loves a belly rub (Picture: Obvious Plant) Basically, Mishka is NOT an office cat (Picture: Obvious Plant) You’ll get some serious conversation out of Leche (Picture: Obvious Plant) You may not even be re-homing a cat when it comes to Delores (Picture: Obvious Plant) Don’t be fooled by her name – Grace is powerful (Picture: Obvious Plant) Choccy knows his tunes, don’t try to fool him with your three chords (Picture: Obvious Plant)
